Class GanttChart

java.lang.Object
com.swiftfox.model.GanttChart
public final class GanttChart extends Object
Represents the Gantt chart used to visualize the execution timeline of processes in the SwiftFox CPU Scheduler Simulator.

This class maintains an observable list of GanttEntry objects that track when each process starts and ends during the scheduling simulation. It supports both regular process entries and idle time entries.

The observable list allows JavaFX UI components to reactively update when entries are added, making it suitable for real-time visualization.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GanttChart

      public GanttChart()

  • Method Details

    • addEntry

      public void addEntry(Process process, long startTime, long endTime)
      Adds a new process entry to the Gantt chart.

      This represents a segment of time during which the given process was executing, defined by a start and end time.

      Parameters:
      process - the process that was executed during the given time span
      startTime - the time at which the process started execution
      endTime - the time at which the process finished execution

    • addIdleEntry

      public void addIdleEntry(long startTime, long endTime)
      Adds an idle time entry to the Gantt chart.

      This represents a time period during which no process was executing (i.e., the CPU was idle). A null process is used to indicate idle time.

      Parameters:
      startTime - the time at which the idle period started
      endTime - the time at which the idle period ended

    • getEntries

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<GanttEntry> getEntries()
      Returns the list of Gantt chart entries.

      Each entry represents a time interval where a specific process (or idle period) was active on the CPU. The list is observable, allowing UI components to react to changes automatically.

      Returns:
      an observable list of GanttEntry objects representing the Gantt chart data
